Objective.evidence: Objectives: We sought to identify factors associated with death and cardiac transplantation in infants undergoing the Norwood procedure and to determine differences in associations that might favor either the modified Blalock-Taussig shunt (MBTS) or a right ventricle-to-pulmonary artery shunt (RVPAS).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Data from 549 subjects (follow-up, 2.7±0.9 years) were analyzed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The RVPAS had better survival in the 51% who were full term with aortic atresia ( P <.001). The MBTS was better among the 4% who were preterm with a patent aortic valve ( P =.003).
